Public MustInherit Class GradientBrush Inherits Brush
public ref class GradientBrush abstract : System::Windows::Media::Brush
.class public auto ansi abstract GradientBrush extends System.Windows.Media.Brush

Docs.summary: An abstract class that describes a gradient, composed of gradient stops. Classes that inherit from describe different ways of interpreting gradient stops.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush> is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object and therefore can be frozen to improve performance. For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you must override the method. Depending on whether your class must perform additional initialization work or contains non-dependency property data members, you might need to override additional methods. For more information about inheriting from types, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's property is even if the source's property is

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's property is even if the source's property is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration that specifies how the gradient's colors are interpolated.
Docs.value: Specifies how the colors in a gradient are interpolated. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows two similar gradients that have different modes of color interpolation, which causes the interpolation to happen in different color spaces. [!code-xaml[GradientBrushExamples_snip#ColorInterpolationModeExampleWholePage](~/samples/snippets/xaml/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GradientBrushExamples_snip/XAML/ColorInterpolationModeExample.xaml#colorinterpolationmodeexamplewholepage)] The following illustration shows what the preceding example produces. ![Two gradients showing different interpolation mode](~/add/media/graphicscolorinterpolationmode.gif "Two gradients showing different interpolation mode")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the brush's gradient stops.
Docs.value: A collection of the objects associated with the brush, each of which specifies a color and an offset along the brush's gradient axis. The default is an empty .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration that specifies whether the gradient brush's positioning coordinates are absolute or relative to the output area.
Docs.value: A value that specifies how the gradient brush's positioning coordinates are interpreted. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A value of indicates the gradient brush's coordinates are expressed using device independent pixels. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the property to specify what coordinate system to use for the and of the gradient. Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of spread method that specifies how to draw a gradient that starts or ends inside the bounds of the object to be painted.
Docs.value: The type of spread method used to paint the gradient. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following illustration shows the available spread methods and their effect on and . The red line indicates the gradient space.
